intro: Achoriphragma villosulum, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its hairy, velvety leaves help reduce water loss, and it produces numerous small flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Achoriphragma villosulum is often found in rocky outcrops and is a common component of fynbos vegetation.
